text: so I feel like there's a little bit of confusion so just to confirm Disney Dream like Valley right now is in Early Access that basically kind of means like it's in a beta state so the game isn't fully completed now you can buy the game on most Platforms in Early Access which means that you're paying for an exclusive sneak peek of the game before it is officially released or if you have Xbox game pass then you actually get this early access version for free once the game has finally been completed they will release it for free to the general public but for now if you want the game whilst they still developing it then you need to pay for it so that begs a question should I wait for the game to become free or should I get it now the game is supposed to become free this year in 2023 although Disney haven't really given us a time frame as to when this is happening so nobody really knows right now so firstly I think it's important to express Disney Dream like Valley has some really positive
title: Should I Buy Disney Dreamlight Valley? (Or Wait Until It's Free)
author: SatchOnSims

text: now so firstly I think it's important to express Disney Dream like Valley has some really positive reviews overwhelmingly positive have on Steam by the way most reviews I've seen are 80 or above Disney Dream like Valley is an extremely interesting game at first it just looks like an animal crossing copycat with a Disney skin on it but when you look at it in further detail it really is a fun unique and compelling experience the best thing about this game is the creativity and being able to change things and build things there is so much customization in this game it is unbelievable that is one of the main reasons why I genuinely love it so much although despite all of the positive reviews there are still some different things to consider as I said before Disney Dreamlight Valley is not in its final State the game is in Early Access this means the game has not been completed yet and there are still a lot of missing features that will win the final game if you purchase it now you will not
title: Should I Buy Disney Dreamlight Valley? (Or Wait Until It's Free)
author: SatchOnSims

text: are still a lot of missing features that will win the final game if you purchase it now you will not have the full experience you are paying for basically half a game it's also important to consider the amount of bugs and glitches guys I am telling you now Disney Dream like Valley such a buggy game so buggy don't get me wrong not every single thing is broken you can still play the game without the bugs really getting in the way that much but there have been many times where I've encountered a quest not recognizing the items I've collected in my inventory so I've had to repurchase the items or re-harvest them or I've had it where the game has Frozen with the menu open or some other UI open and it won't close so I have to quit the game via task manager and ending the application process I've had to restart this game so many times it is ridiculous luckily Dreamlight Valley does auto save a very regular interval so it's not like you're undoing tons of progress and you have to start all
title: Should I Buy Disney Dreamlight Valley? (Or Wait Until It's Free)
author: SatchOnSims

text: a very regular interval so it's not like you're undoing tons of progress and you have to start all over again but still it is a very big new sense the truth is many video game Publishers are releasing Half Baked video games and just updating them with patches as the game goes on it's almost like the new Norm for a video game to be released broken and to use the players as testers to just do some fixes until the Game Stop selling and making money and then they just completely abandon it in whatever state that it's in it's a totally unacceptable yet normalized practice in video games recently however one thing I do appreciate is that Disney Dream like Valley is very transparent about that it is being marketed right now as an early access game many Publishers as I said will just release it as the final products and then just make changes as they go along but Disney have been honest about the fact that the game isn't ready for a full release especially on Twitter they're really open about
title: Should I Buy Disney Dreamlight Valley? (Or Wait Until It's Free)
author: SatchOnSims

text: fact that the game isn't ready for a full release especially on Twitter they're really open about the bug and glitch fixes and openly asking plays to report them so they can improve the game and it's ready for full release so it's not like Disney are being deceptive about the existence of bugs and glitches in it I'm not saying the bugs and glitches in dreamlike Valley are so bad that you literally cannot play or enjoy the experience but what I will say is it's more so just like a small nuisance every now and then but you can still enjoy the game don't get me wrong so should I buy the game now or should I wait this depends on one well two very important factors firstly can you afford it I feel like that's just an obvious one can you afford it yes or no but secondly are you like a hardcore fan of this cozy simulation gaming genre thanks to Animal Crossing New Horizons so many people entered this gaming genre having the creative freedom to basically do anything you want and it's in a
title: Should I Buy Disney Dreamlight Valley? (Or Wait Until It's Free)

text: this gaming genre having the creative freedom to basically do anything you want and it's in a chilled out way that's fun it's not like a stressful gaming experience it's not like a gaming experience so it raises your blood pressure or your heart rate or gets you excited it's just chilled out and fun also games like stardew Valley another very chilled out and creative simulation game and then we also have games like story of Seasons making its Mark after its long-awaited Revival and then we've got games like coral island which are up and coming chilled out simulation games are taking over if you are a proper hardcore fan of these kinds of games I do feel like Disney Dream like Valley offers something very unique aside from just having a Disney skin on it it's one of the first major simulation games that literally lets you customize everything in Animal Crossing New Horizons let's be honest moving buildings around can be a literal pain in the ass but in Disney Dreamlight Valley you can
title: Should I Buy Disney Dreamlight Valley? (Or Wait Until It's Free)
author: SatchOnSims

text: moving buildings around can be a literal pain in the ass but in Disney Dreamlight Valley you can literally move anything anywhere from the offset yes right now the missions are limited but unless you're really rushing and stressing yourself out over completing the game you will always have something to do sometimes I start the game and I want to focus on Gathering and harvesting materials other times I want to play around with the world changing things up and designing different spaces but then other days I might decide I want to renovate my house and make it look nice but then on another day I might want to change up my character design and buy some new cool outfits for them when you first start the game I will be honest it does feel like yet another freemium mobile app game do you know what I mean like those mobile app games which have all of the currencies and cash grabby designs where it's like you need 800 gems to unlock this story but the gems are only sold in packs of 799 like
title: Should I Buy Disney Dreamlight Valley? (Or Wait Until It's Free)
author: SatchOnSims

text: it's like you need 800 gems to unlock this story but the gems are only sold in packs of 799 like it does feel like when those games but when you actually get into it it's not really like that the gameplay mechanics over time do feel unique as if they offer something different that other similar games do not have or at least they expand on the mechanics of these other similar games and make them more refined as such Disney Dream like Valley does feel like a well-rounded and unique experience yes they do upsell some things for example over Christmas they have this Christmas battle pass style thing where you can unlock Christmasy things by completing certain tasks some things were free but the majority required you to purchase the premium version of the past of course with Disney dreamlike Valley becoming a free-to-play game this does seem like a standard to be honest but the fundamentals of the game are totally free and you can enjoy the fundamentals of the game without ever purchasing a
title: Should I Buy Disney Dreamlight Valley? (Or Wait Until It's Free)
author: SatchOnSims

text: the game are totally free and you can enjoy the fundamentals of the game without ever purchasing a single thing now don't get me wrong if they started locking certain Disney Worlds or Disney characters behind a paywall then I would have something to say about that something very negative but Disney have not suggested that this is happening for now every new Disney character and world is a part of the free experience it only seems to be superficial things like outfits and some furniture which is behind a paywall but even then most of it is not behind a table you can unlock cool things for free Disney themed stuff with that being said if you are a big fan of these kinds of games I don't think you will regret purchasing it in Early Access I will admit the premium versions of the early access pass are ridiculously expensive just for a few extra cosmetic items like guys it is not worth that price at all even like the standard early access pass for that in the UK it costs about 23 pounds
title: Should I Buy Disney Dreamlight Valley? (Or Wait Until It's Free)

text: price at all even like the standard early access pass for that in the UK it costs about 23 pounds which I think is quite expensive to be honest especially when you're just buying Like An Early Access thing which is gonna be free anyway so with that being said like if money is a bit of a barrier for you you could buy a much cheaper similar game like for example stardew Valley which is a complete Game experience is no DLC that isn't a freemium stuff it is just one whole complete game and it is right now sold for like half the price of Disney Dream like Valley so if you don't own that game or you want to get a similar fully released game for the same price and I would do that instead but if money is not an object for you I genuinely do recommend getting the game now just being aware that it is not in its final state so you will experience bugging eating glitchy things like I have you will experienced characters clipping through each other and walking around weirdly so set your
